channel.title: Client Compiler Errors [667]
channel.description:
Hey,
So I have a 667 Source and Client, and I've been trying to sign into it on localhost.
First off, when I run the Client compiler, I get; [code]javac: file not found: src\Loader.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
So I figured; well, common sense, make a folder named src and put loader.java in there, or simply remove the src\Loader.java in the Compiler code. After trying this, I receive the following when compiling the client; [code]src\Loader.java:64: error: cannot find symbol new Censor(); ^ symbol: class Censor location: class Loader src\Loader.java:254: error: cannot find symbol GameStub.provideLoaderApplet(this); ^ symbol: variable GameStub location: class Loader src\Loader.java:255: error: cannot find symbol client client1 = new client(); ^ symbol: class client location: class Loader src\Loader.java:255: error: cannot find symbol client client1 = new client(); ^ symbol: class client location: class Loader src\Loader.java:293: error: cannot find symbol new Screenshot( ^ symbol: class Screenshot location: class Loader 5 errors Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
My current client compiler code is: [code]@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_05/bin/javac" -cp lib/*; -d bin -sourcepath src src/Loader.java pause[/code]
And yes, I did create a folder named src and placed the Loader.java in there, go the compiler code still contains "src/Loader.java"
Thanks in advance, any responses are appreciated.

item.title: Client Compiler Errors [667]
item.dc:creator: @TeeBark TeeBark
item.description:
@TeeBark wrote:

Hey,

So I have a 667 Source and Client, and I’ve been trying to sign into it on localhost.

First off, when I run the Client compiler, I get;

javac: file not found: src\Loader.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .

So I figured; well, common sense, make a folder named src and put loader.java in there, or simply remove the src\Loader.java in the Compiler code. After trying this, I receive the following when compiling the client;

src\Loader.java:64: error: cannot find symbol new Censor(); ^ symbol: class Censor location: class Loader src\Loader.java:254: error: cannot find symbol GameStub.provideLoaderApplet(this); ^ symbol: variable GameStub location: class Loader src\Loader.java:255: error: cannot find symbol client client1 = new client(); ^ symbol: class client location: class Loader src\Loader.java:255: error: cannot find symbol client client1 = new client(); ^ symbol: class client location: class Loader src\Loader.java:293: error: cannot find symbol new Screenshot( ^ symbol: class Screenshot location: class Loader 5 errors Press any key to continue . . .

My current client compiler code is:

@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_05/bin/javac" -cp lib/*; -d bin -sourcepath src src/Loader.java pause

And yes, I did create a folder named src and placed the Loader.java in there, go the compiler code still contains “src/Loader.java”

Thanks in advance, any responses are appreciated.
